questiontext.text:
Exercise

Let \(x=-d\) be the directrix for the 2 below conics, and \(e\) be their eccentricity. Drag the sliders on the graphs below to create the following curves (Note that the red dashed line is \(x=-d\)):

\(r = \dfrac{{@dd3*ee3*multiple@}}{{@multiple@}-{@ee3*multiple*cos(theta)@}}\)

[[jsxgraph input-ref-ans3='ans3Ref']] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8, -8], keepaspectratio: true, showCopyright: false, axis: true, showNavigation: true, }); JXG.Options.text.useMathHax = true; var e_third= board.create('slider',[[1, -3], [5, -3], [0.25, {#init_e#}, 2]], {name:'e', snapwidth: 0.25}); var de_third= board.create('slider',[[1, -4], [5, -4], [-4, {#init_d#}, 4]], {name:'d*e', snapwidth: 0.25}); var p1 = board.create('point', [ function() { return -de_third.Value()/e_third.Value(); }, -10 ], {visible: false}); var p2 = board.create('point', [ function() { return -de_third.Value()/e_third.Value(); }, 10 ], {visible: false}); var direct= board.create('line', [p1, p2], { straightFirst: false, straightLast: false, strokeColor: 'red', dash: 2, name: 'direct', fixed: true, }); var curve = board.create('curve', [ function (theta) { return de_third.Value() / (1 - e_third.Value() * Math.cos(theta)); }, [0, 0], 0, 2 * Math.PI], {curveType: 'polar', strokewidth: 2, strokeColor: 'blue'}); e_third.on('drag', function () { curve.updateCurve(); board.update(); }); de_third.on('drag', function () { curve.updateCurve(); board.update(); }); stack_jxg.bind_list_of(ans3Ref, [e_third, de_third]); [[/jsxgraph]] [[feedback:prt3]]

[[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]]
